title.native: 最果てのパラディン 鉄錆の山の王
title.romaji: Saihate no Paladin: Tetsusabi no Yama no Ou
title.english: The Faraway Paladin: The Lord of Rust Mountains

description:
The second season of Saihate no Paladin.

Two years had passed since he left the City of the Dead, and Will was seventeen by count. As a lord, he developed "Torch Port, a river port of light", and gradually the people's activities and smiles returned to "Beast Woods". However, out-of-season flowers bloom profusely, and an abnormality is discovered in the forest. Will and his friends head into the depths of the forest to solve this problem, and receive an ominous prophecy from the king of the forest.

"In the Iron Rust Mountains, the 'Fire of Black Calamity' will occur. The fire will spread, or it will burn everything in this land."

What is the calamity that sleeps in the ruined dwarven city of Tetsusabi Sanmyaku...!?

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: พาลาดิน ยอดอัศวินจากแดนไกล ภาค 2
The Faraway Paladin: O Senhor das Montanhas de Ferrugem
世界盡頭的聖騎士 鐵鏽之山的君王
The Faraway Paladin : Le Seigneur des Montagnes de Rouille

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
Former adult game scenario writer. He is a creator of cult classic Shizuku, Kizuato and To Heart.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takahasi)

__[Website](http://yanaginagi.net/) | [Personal Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi) | [Professional Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi_info)__

__Introduction:__
yanaginagi, alternatively known as Gazelle, or otherwise simply known as nagi, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger under record label NBC Universal. She is known for performing as a guest singer for the band [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell) under the name nagi from 2009-2011.

__Biography:__
During her childhood, she first became interested in music with the help of an electronic organ her mother received from the neighboring residents. She would go on to start composing music during Junior High School using DTM (Desktop Music) software her brother had bought.

In 2006, as a 19 year old, she would start making her indie debut by posting songs to the music site Player's Kingdom, where she would go on to produce many original songs. She has also posted songs to the video sharing site Nico Nico Douga under the name Gazelle, and participated as one of the singers in "Lantis Suite feat. Nico Nico Artists". During her stay at Nico Nico Douga, she would at one point come in contact with [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941/ryo), the leader of supercell, which eventually led her to start working with him. A couple of years later in March 2008, she would retire from music activites on the site Nico Nico Douga.

On February 29, 2012, she would make her major debut by releasing the single "[Vidro Moyou](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7_iMfWt1hA8)" through Geneon Universal.

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%84%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E), edited)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YoshimasaTerui)__

__Yoshimasa Terui__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and guitarist. He composed music for the idol unit [Sora Tob Sakana](https://anilist.co/staff/126806/Sora-Tob-Sakana) and is a member of the math-rock band Haisuinonasa.

__[Website](http://yanaginagi.net/) | [Personal Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi) | [Professional Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanaginagi_info)__

__Introduction:__
yanaginagi, alternatively known as Gazelle, or otherwise simply known as nagi, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger under record label NBC Universal. She is known for performing as a guest singer for the band [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913/supercell) under the name nagi from 2009-2011.

__Biography:__
During her childhood, she first became interested in music with the help of an electronic organ her mother received from the neighboring residents. She would go on to start composing music during Junior High School using DTM (Desktop Music) software her brother had bought.

In 2006, as a 19 year old, she would start making her indie debut by posting songs to the music site Player's Kingdom, where she would go on to produce many original songs. She has also posted songs to the video sharing site Nico Nico Douga under the name Gazelle, and participated as one of the singers in "Lantis Suite feat. Nico Nico Artists". During her stay at Nico Nico Douga, she would at one point come in contact with [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941/ryo), the leader of supercell, which eventually led her to start working with him. A couple of years later in March 2008, she would retire from music activites on the site Nico Nico Douga.

On February 29, 2012, she would make her major debut by releasing the single "[Vidro Moyou](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7_iMfWt1hA8)" through Geneon Universal.

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%84%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E%E3%81%AA%E3%81%8E), edited)

[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YoshimasaTerui)__

__Yoshimasa Terui__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and guitarist. He composed music for the idol unit [Sora Tob Sakana](https://anilist.co/staff/126806/Sora-Tob-Sakana) and is a member of the math-rock band Haisuinonasa.

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)

__[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takada.html)__

__Ryuuichi Takada__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of music unit MONACA. He mainly composes and arranges for videogames, having worked on the soundtracks for Soul Calibur, Tekken, Katamari Damacy, and The iDOLM@STER.

[Twitter](https://x.com/KeigoHoashi)

Keigo Hoashi is a composer and arranger, and a pianist. He was formerly part of the unit [MONACA](https://anilist.co/staff/110481/MONACA).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/erickbglx) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/erickbglx/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/ErickDublou)

Erick Bougleux is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director.
